locations.name: Sveriges Kreditbank
locations.description: The bank in Stockholm where the robbery and hostage situation marked as the birthplace of "Stockholm Syndrome" unfolded. Listen here

locations.name: Prime Minister’s Residence, Sweden
locations.description: Residence of Olof Palme, who communicated with the hostages. Referenced during Kristin Enmark’s phone call with Swedish Prime Minister Olof Palme. Listen here

locations.name: Sarah Lawrence College
locations.description: The college mentioned in relation to Daniel Barban Levin’s involvement in a cult situation. Listen here

locations.name: Hibernia Bank
locations.description: Site of the bank robbery involving Patricia Hearst and the Symbionese Liberation Army. Listen here

locations.name: Musée des Arts et Métiers
locations.description: Museum in Paris housing original metric standards, including the original meter and liter. Listen here

locations.name: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
locations.description: The American institution responsible for maintaining and advancing the standards of measurement, including work on the kilogram. Listen here

locations.name: National Bureau of Weights and Measures (BIPM)
locations.description: The international bureau in France where "Le Grand K" is kept and safeguarded. Listen here

locations.name: University College London
locations.description: Sophie Scott, a professor of cognitive neuroscience, discusses research on laughter. Listen here

locations.name: University of Hertfordshire
locations.description: Richard Wiseman, a professor of psychology, conducted an experiment to find the world’s funniest joke. Listen here

locations.name: Mumbai (Chinchpokli)
locations.description: Mentioned by Indian comic Urooj Ashfaq as a neighborhood in Mumbai with a funny-sounding name. Listen here

locations.name: Jaffa
locations.description: Location of Maya Kosover’s birthday party, which initiated the story. Listen here

locations.name: Ukraine
locations.description: Source of eggs used for the surrogacy process. Listen here

locations.name: Kolkata
locations.description: Mentioned as the hometown of one of the surrogates interviewed in the shelter houses. Listen here

locations.name: Darjeeling
locations.description: Mentioned as the hometown of a surrogate. Listen here

locations.name: Kathmandu
locations.description: A popular city which hosts houses for surrogates in it's outskirts Listen here

locations.name: Lincoln General Hospital
locations.description: Jim Steiner worked at Lincoln General Hospital, where emergency medicine practices inspired the creation of ATLS. Listen here

locations.name: Hebron, Nebraska
locations.description: Site of the small hospital where Jim Steiner and his family were initially taken after a plane crash. Listen here

locations.name: Auburn, Nebraska
locations.description: Location where the first ATLS (Advanced Trauma Life Support) course was taught in 1978. Listen here

locations.name: Baltimore, Maryland
locations.description: Home of Dr. Sharon Henry, a trauma surgery professor at Shock Trauma, who reflects on trauma care developments. Listen here

locations.name: Gombe National Park
locations.description: The site where Barbara Smuts encountered the chimpanzee Goblin when working with Jane Goodall. Listen here

locations.name: Lucy’s First Home
locations.description: Lucy the chimpanzee's home where she grew up with the Temerlins before being taken to Africa. Listen here

locations.name: Dakar
locations.description: The city where Lucy and the Temerlins first arrived in Africa before moving her to the reserve. Listen here

locations.name: Nature Reserve
locations.description: The initial location where Lucy was placed before being moved to a more remote island. Listen here

locations.name: Great Ape Trust
locations.description: A bonobo research center in Iowa where Sue Savage-Rumbaugh conducted experiments and developed communication with bonobos like Kanzi. Listen here

locations.name: Peter Luger Steakhouse
locations.description: A famous steakhouse in Brooklyn where Amy Pearl frequently dined before developing her meat allergy. Listen here

locations.name: University of Virginia
locations.description: The institution where Dr. Thomas Platts-Mills works and conducted research into the alpha-gal allergy. Listen here

locations.name: Blue Ridge Mountains
locations.description: The area where Dr. Thomas Platts-Mills encountered ticks during a hike, leading to his own meat allergy. Listen here

locations.name: Tick-Induced Allergies Research and Awareness Center
locations.description: The TIARA, led by Dr. Sheryl van Nunen. Listen here
